intro: Eriolopha ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf eriolopha, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
